turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm having trouble with my SmartHome Hub, model SHH-2000. It keeps disconnecting from the internet every few minutes. It's driving me crazy!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! Thank you for contacting SmartHome Support. I understand you're experiencing intermittent internet disconnections with your SHH-2000 hub. I can certainly help you with this. To start, could you please confirm the color of the LED indicator light on the front of the hub when it disconnects?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: It flashes red. I've already tried restarting it, like, five times. And my internet is working fine for all my other devices.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, a flashing red light typically indicates a connectivity issue. Since you've already tried restarting the hub, let's try power cycling your modem and router as well. Unplug them both from the power outlet, wait 30 seconds, plug the modem back in first, wait for it to fully connect, then plug the router back in. After your router is online, see if the hub connects normally.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, fine. I'll try that. It better work. By the way, is there any way to prioritize the hub's bandwidth? I have a lot of devices on my network, and I suspect it's getting pushed aside.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Regarding bandwidth prioritization, that functionality depends on your router's capabilities. Some routers offer Quality of Service (QoS) settings that allow you to prioritize network traffic to specific devices. Consult your router's manual or your internet service provider's support for specific instructions on configuring QoS. I can also provide you with a general guide if you provide the make and model of your router.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, thanks, that's helpful. Power cycling the modem and router seems to have fixed the immediate problem. I'll look into the QoS settings later. Appreciate the help!
